reviews.title: Has stood the test of time

reviews.text: is this the Ritz Carlton Way? I doubte !!!
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: I am not used to fancy 5 stars hotels and this hotel was paid for by business. The service is excellent, the food is fantastic, the rooms are great. The most important thing about a hotel is to sleep comfortably and peacefully and this hotel provided more than this. There was no noise or problems. Location is great. The breakfasts were very tasty.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: One thing that bothered me was that one has to pay for wi-fi at RMB120 per day. Most hotels offer this service free. Also, not that this is the hotel's fault, but nothing in such a grand hotel is affordable to normal people so drinking or eating there at night is just not an option. Fortunately there are so many other places to go to in this area. My favorate was the food court at the Jingang Temple subway station entrance. Hundreds of places to choose from at such affordable prices. This is a 10min walk to the West in Nanjing road.
reviews.title: Central location, does not meet Ritz-Carlton standard expectation

reviews.text: Stayed there on a weekend in Nov 2011. Good business traveller hotel with nicely furbished rooms but does not have the "luxury" twist one would expect from a Ritz-Carlton. Staff friendly and helpful. All in all a neutral feeling about the place. Nothing to complain but if one is looking for a Ritz-Carlton luxury I suggest not to consider this property.
reviews.title: Slightly Outdated, Check-In Mess Up was Horrible

reviews.text: So here I am, flew in on the red-eye and I was dead tired. After many hours of travel, I finally reached the Ritz at 2pm. I checked in, and to my despair, they had no available rooms. I booked this many months in advance so I was pretty upset. I even booked the club level room. Well, they sent me up to the club level lounge to rest.. but honestly, I was just so tired that I ended up sitting on a couch and trying to sleep... Not possible.
reviews.title: Unworthy of the Brand

reviews.text: Earlier, they had told me that the wait time would be no longer than an hour. What a lie. I went up to the desk at 3pm and my room was STILL NOT AVAILABLE. Incredible. I have been sitting on the couch at the club level in plain sight of the check-in lady and they had no sense to rush the cleaning of my room? I was pretty upset.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, spectacular interior, food lacking

reviews.text: I have staying at this hotel for a couple years while traveling on business trips. The hotel is very high in service and caters to foreigners. They make everything incredibly easy for you, scheduling cars to and from the airport to pick you up, even buying train tickets for you on line. The hotel is in a big plaza named the American Center by the locals. Within the plaza is a Starbucks, massage place, several great restaurants (element Fresh is my favorite), and there is even a City Market grocery store in the lower level. You really never need to leave the area! The concierge floor of the hotel offers breakfast, a light lunch, and appetizers and drinks. There is also computer access on this level so it is totally worth going for the upgrade.
reviews.title: Amazing service, luxury hotel

reviews.text: The hotel rooms are beautiful, although I think starting to show wear in the carpet & linens. Bathtubs are fantastic, showers a little tiny. Bathrooms are large. Room has excellent closet space. Hotel fitness center is large and has a great selection of machines, weights, and a huge pool. This is a very comfortable place to stay. Although very limited feel of being in China it is low stress for the weary international traveler.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: I just got home and realized one of my 500hkd bill has gone missing. I thought through the past week and i am certain there should have been two 500hkd bills left in my purse. Granted it's too late to file a complaint and I seriously doubt that i would be able to get my money back, i hope your company would pay closer attention to employees when it comes to issuess related to customer belongings.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel at least once annually for the last 3 years.
reviews.title: What a Difference a Year Makes

reviews.text: What I liked about the hotel:
reviews.title: A Chinese copy of Western Culture - Incredible Compared to other Chinese 5 Stars

reviews.text: The hotel is nice but I would also say dated to some degree. At check in I was booked for a non-smoking room but they had me for a smoking room. Their solution was to take the ashtrays out of the room. I tried it but the smell was terrible so I finally demanded another room which took severals calls and finally a demand to talk to the manager. I was moved to a slightly smaller room just down the hallway on the same floor. I was club level and the club was very nice as I was there on business with 4 other people and we were able to have some meeting over drinks and food. The bed was excellent and the pillows were awesome! Over all room amenities were what you would expect from Ritz. A tip is that there is a taxi queue to the right out the front door, show your room key to make sure that you get the best service.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: No view, but excellent locale within easy walking distance to sights, shopping and restauatnts/ The rooms are abit dated, but still good accommodation. The Ritz Bar on the second floor is very pricey (33% above The Vue on the top-36 floor of Hyatt with a view of the Bund), and the service is poor.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: What a great experience Shanghai is. The Portman Ritz was the best hotel I have ever stayed in. I don't know what it cost, but it was luxurious and centrally located for all kinds of excursions. No free Wifi
reviews.title: Tony

reviews.text: I've stayed in quite a few hotels in Shanghai, and I have to say this was most disappointing....not only for a Ritz but also in terms of the other options this city has to offer. In general, it's a bit outdated -- it's dark and a little dingy -- and the service is mediocre at best, particularly if you're staying for business, or need extra help because you don't speak Mandarin. If you are considering staying here, you should really consider one of the Hyatts, which are lovely and a pleasure to stay at.
reviews.title: Disappointing!! Not recommended for business -- or personal travel

reviews.text: My review is based on quite a few things, which although I'm willing to overlook in a standard hotel, I would not expect to happen at a Ritz, and especially not when they charge the rate they do. I don't mean to be picky, but honestly this is not 4 or 5 star material:
reviews.title: Good for business but not as indulgent as some Ritz-Carltons

reviews.text: * My room had pieces of what looked like cereal on the floor, which were probably too big to be picked up by a vaccuum -- these remained the entire 3 days.
reviews.title: not worth the money - very mediocre cuisine- average service

reviews.text: * The furniture and walls are scuffed / worn to the point that everything seems a bit dirty. I know they did a large renovation, but I can't imagine what it must have looked like before.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

reviews.text: * The walls are either thin or the phones ring abnormally loudly -- I thought my own phone was ringing, but realized it was coming from some other room. Also, the phones are abysmal and probably 10+ years old -- one of mine was almost unusable because it had so much static, and the volume control was broken on the other.
reviews.title: Unhelpful concierge

reviews.text: I stayed here two nights for business and was completely satisfied with the visit. The check-in was rapid and more than one staff asked to help me with my bag. The room was of decent size and very comfortable. Super clean facility. The breakfast buffet was good. The location made it very easy to get out and around to some of the nightspots in Shanghai. I think it's a nice touch that when you ask for a wake up call, a real person calls you. When I went to collect my bag I barely had the claim check out of my pocket before someone was there to assist. Then, they ushered me straight to a cab even though it was raining and the taxi cue was long. I would look forward to staying here again.
reviews.title: Excellent location. Great for business trip.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Portman Ritz-Carlton with 2 friends as part of a weekend package holiday from Hong Kong. The hotel is much better compared to other hotels in a similar price range but not quite up to the standard of other Ritz-Carlton hotels. The location is great, close to Nanjing Road shopping and the French Concession, and a plus is that taxi drivers know where it is without needing to have the name and address in Chinese.
reviews.title: Great location and decent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few disappointments: We had requested a non-smoking room but there was still a faint smell of smoke in the room (common in Chinese hotels). Also, we added an extra roll-away bed in the room which was rock hard (also common in Chinese hotels).
reviews.title: Its still the Ritz

reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel! their staff, from the doormen to the room cleaning staff are truly special. They sincerely welcomed us back to the hotel each day and were very willing to do anything we might need.
reviews.title: Well located for shopping - if you can afford it

reviews.text: The restaurant has a buffet the way a buffet should be and the wait staff are very attentive to your every need. In our two weeks in China this buffet was the best dinner we had the entire time, including the 6 days of shipboard buffet meals.
reviews.title: Stay here for the location, not because it has Ritz in the name

reviews.text: Several co-workers had recommended the Portman Ritz. While it is a nice hotel with well appointed rooms, it is not up to the typical Ritz level of service. I didn't get the warm welcome that my co-workers had raved about. Some of the common areas looked worn.
reviews.title: Good, but not as good as other Ritz

reviews.text: There are plenty of restaurants and shopping around the Ritz to meet mosts cravings. If you want to venture further and don't have a driver, the taxi stand can have long queues, especially on Friday and Saturday nights. The metro is 5-6 blocks in either direction.
reviews.title: Great place, great rooms, great service

reviews.text: It was my second stay at this hotel and it is a very nice place to stay. The service is excellent, the rooms are very nice and the location is perfect. The Japansese sushi place inside the hotel is excellent and having the City Market (Western market) is a nice treat when traveling in Shanghai. It is close to the Jing An temple and great shopping.
reviews.title: Shocking Luxury

reviews.text: Smart hotel with friendly and efficient staff -- BUT -- one of us was standing barefoot in the bathroom and touched the shaving mirror and received a significant shock -- much more than a static electricity shock. Luckily person had not just stepped out of the shower. We informed the concierge who called the manager immediately who was most concerned for our well being. Breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: Overrated - won't be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would probably look for another hotel if we visit Shanghai again.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL & CLUB STAFF BUT LIMITED FOOD PRESENTATION
